abstract: Enables user suppression of dialogs and alerts presented within `self`, with a custom suppression message on macOS. Unused on other platforms.

declaration.code: nonisolated func dialogSuppressionToggle(_ label: Text, isSuppressed: Binding<Bool>) -> some View

overview:
## Discussion

Applying dialog suppression adds a toggle to dialogs on macOS, which allows the user to request the alert not be displayed again. Typically whether a dialog is suppressed is stored in `AppStorage` and used to decide whether to present the dialog in the future.

The following example configures a `confirmationDialog` with a suppression toggle. The toggle’s state is stored in `AppStorage` and used to determine whether or not to show the dialog when the “Delete Items” button is pressed.

items.description: Configures the icon used by dialogs within this view.
items.name: dialogIcon(_:)

items.description: Configures the icon used by alerts.
items.name: dialogIcon(_:)

items.description: Enables user suppression of dialogs and alerts presented within `self`, with a default suppression message on macOS. Unused on other platforms.
items.name: dialogSuppressionToggle(isSuppressed:)

items.description: Enables user suppression of an alert with a custom suppression message.
items.name: dialogSuppressionToggle(isSuppressed:)

items.description: Enables user suppression of an alert with a custom suppression message.
items.name: dialogSuppressionToggle(_:isSuppressed:)
